name: Himyar
declaringWar: You are an obstacle and you shall be removed!
defeated: You may take our lands, but you will never take our pride!
introduction: Welcome to my court. I bet the smell of our Incense got you here.
hateYes: This offer is too good to reject.
tradeRequest: I think that's a fair offer.
uniques: Double quantity of [Incense] produced
May convert Incense to Myrrh or Frankincense luxury resources
[+10]% Strength <when fighting in [Desert] tiles>
[+15]% [Gold] from Trade Routes <during a Golden Age>
[+1 Faith] from every [Incense] <after discovering [Currency]>

name: Epirus
declaringWar: There can be only one king. Prepare for battle!
attacked: I think my emissary must have been late, I already declared war on you!
defeated: You were a worthy opponent. The gods will welcome me!
introduction: Welcome to Epirus, friend. I am king Pyrrhus. Are you another expenda... I mean Ally... or perhaps a next target of my army?
hateYes: This offer is too good to reject.
afterPeace: Hail, great lord. This was indeed a good fight.
uniqueText: All military units have +25% more strength when attacking cities, but suffer -25% penalty when defending against cities. +25% [Production] when constructing military units in capital. Gains a free [Great General] upon researching Bronze Working and Steel
uniques: [Land] units gain the [Pyrrhic Victory] promotion
[+25]% Production when constructing [Mounted] units [in holy cities]
Free [Great General] appears <upon conquering a city> <with [33]% chance>
Earn [33]% of the damage done to [Land] units as [Faith] <on foreign continents>
[10]% of excess happiness converted to [Production]

name: Scythia
declaringWar: I am afraid your reign is over!
attacked: We will sunk you in your own blood.
introduction: Welcome to the steppes. I am Ateas, the king of the Scythian people.
hateYes: This offer is too good to reject.
afterPeace: I hope you've learned something from our last dispute.
uniques: [+1 Food, +1 Culture] from every [Horses]
Starts with [Archery]
[-25]% Culture cost of natural border growth [in all cities]
Double quantity of [Horse] produced
[+50]% XP gained from combat <for [Mounted] units> <with [33]% chance>

name: India
declaringWar: I have just received a report that large numbers of my troops have crossed your borders.
attacked: My attempts to avoid violence have failed. An eye for an eye only makes the world blind.
defeated: You can chain me, you can torture me, you can even destroy this body, but you will never imprison my mind.
introduction: Hello, I am Mohandas Gandhi. My people call me Bapu, but please, call me friend.
tradeRequest: My friend, are you interested in this arrangement?
uniques: Unhappiness from number of Cities doubled
[-50]% Unhappiness from [Population] [in all cities]
[+20]% growth [in all non-occupied cities]

name: Lithuania
declaringWar: You have brought the wrath of Dievas upon yourself!
attacked: We shall now show you the true power of Lithuania and our true gods!
defeated: Dievas, Perkunas, why do you bring the wraith of Giltine upon me?
introduction: I am Gediminas, the Grand Duke of Lithuania, by the good will of Dievas, stay out of my way and none blood shall be spilled.
hateYes: Remember, never reject a good offer.
tradeRequest: Here is an offer that might benefit both of us.
uniques: [+1 Faith] from [Forest] tiles without [Lumber mill] [in all non-occupied cities]
All newly-trained [Sword] units [in holy cities] receive the [Woodsman] promotion
[-40]% Culture cost of natural border growth [in annexed cities] <after founding a Pantheon>
[+10]% Food is carried over after population increases [in all cities in which the majority religion is a major religion] <in cities without a [Temple]>

name: The Olmec
declaringWar: War! The Feathered Serpent demands sacrificial blood!
defeated: That's the greatest sacrifice I can offer You!
introduction: Were you send by the great Serpent?
afterPeace: What such bloodhirsty beast might want?
uniques: May buy [National Wonder] buildings with [Faith] for [1] times their normal Production cost
Free Great Person <upon entering a Golden Age> <with [22]% chance>

name: Nok
attacked: Oh, I see. I did not expect anything else from you.
defeated: We might die, but our culture is eternal.
introduction: Welcome to our lands. May there be peace among us!
hateYes: This offer is too good to reject.
uniqueText: All cities provide 1 copy of [Terracotta] luxury resource. +1 [Science] from every Iron.
uniques: Gain a free [Free Terracotta] [in all cities]
[+1 Science] from every [Iron]

name: Phoenicia
declaringWar: We accept you for no longer!
attacked: I am disappointed. Can't we simply trade and avoid the conflict?
defeated: Yes, take my lands. I doubt you will make any better use of them!
introduction: I am Hiram of Tyre. If you are here to trade, let's go straight into business.
hateYes: This offer is too good to reject.
afterPeace: If we are no longer at war, maybe we should trade?
uniques: Starts with [Sailing]
[+1 Gold] from every [Fishing Boats]
[+50]% Production when constructing [Work Boats] units [in all cities]
[+4 Gold, +1 Science] from each Trade Route
[+50]% Gold from Great Merchant trade missions

name: Macrobia
declaringWar: You have had your chance, now prepare for war!
attacked: You DARE declare war on us? We shall make you suffer!
defeated: So that is how it all ends. I've never expected to end as a slave!
introduction: Who are you? I bet You are here to admire our wealth.
hateHello: Don't waste much of my time!
hateNo: No one would agree to that. Ever.
hateYes: You can't simply refuse such offer.
afterPeace: We shall now pray for the better, I mean more profitable, days!
tradeRequest: I bring you an excellent offer!
uniqueText: Earns [Gold] for killing enemy land units
uniques: Earn [33]% of killed [Land] unit's [Cost] as [Gold]
Retain [25]% of the happiness from a luxury after the last copy has been traded away
[+2 Gold, -1 Food] from each Trade Route
[Gold] cost of purchasing [Land] units [-25]%

name: Sumeria
startIntroPart1: Blessings of the heaven be upon you, oh mighty Gilgamesh, the legendary god-king of the Sumer nation. The stories of your life amaze the world to this day. After your death, the gods welcomed you as one of their kind.
startIntroPart2: O great Gilgamesh, builder of the Sumer might, your people seek your guidance! Will you descend from the heavens to astonish the world with your incredible deeds once again? Will you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: That's enough, prepare to be smashed into the dust!
attacked: You dare to attack a demigod? You will regret this sooner than you think!
defeated: Defeat. A mere mortal emerged victorious. Can't wait to see how long you will last. Even demigods aren't invicible.
introduction: I am Gilgamesh, a demigod who descended to Earth to lead the mighty city of Uruk. Let there be peace among us!
hateLetsHearIt: Just speak, don't waste my time!
afterPeace: Maybe we should celebrate the end of war?
tradeRequest: I present you this trade offer.
uniqueText: All land units move twice as fast on tiles next to rivers. +2 [Science] in Capital. +1 [Faith] from flood plains. +20% Growth in the capital.
uniques: [+2 Science, +1 Culture] [in capital]
[Land] units gain the [Cradle of Civilizations] promotion
[+1 Faith] from [Flood plains] tiles [in all cities]
[+20]% [Food] [in capital]

name: Atlantis
startIntroPart1: Greetings, Evenor. Few empires have sparked such wonder, such curiosity. As the sunken world of Atlantis. Torn and sunk by divine punishment, your people advanced beyond imagination and ruled over this world's endless seas.
startIntroPart2: There are many who wish to see your magnificence brought to life once more, lord Evenor. Can you stand the test of time and rule over the seas once more?
declaringWar: The seas have had enough of you!
introduction: Ever try holding your breath underwater?
neutralHello: You should come for a visit.
hateHello: You are not welcome in the sea.
uniqueText: +1 Food on Coasts and Oceans. Doubled after discovering Astronomy. Great Improvements can be built on water, and provide double yields while there.
uniques: [+1 Food] from every [Coast]
[+1 Food] from every [Coast] <after discovering [Astronomy]>
[+1 Food] from every [Ocean]
[+1 Food] from every [Ocean] <after discovering [Astronomy]>
[+1] Sight <for [Embarked] units>
[+1 Culture] from every specialist [in all coastal cities] <during a Golden Age>

name: Iroquois
declaringWar: You are a plague upon Mother Earth! Prepare for battle!
attacked: You evil creature! My braves will slaughter you!
defeated: You have defeated us... but our spirits will never be vanquished! We shall return!
introduction: Greetings, stranger. I am Hiawatha, speaker for the Iroquois. We seek peace with all, but we do not shrink from war.
tradeRequest: Does this trade work for you, my friend?
uniques: All units move through Forest and Jungle Tiles in friendly territory as if they have roads. These tiles can be used to establish City Connections upon researching the Wheel.
[+15]% Strength <for [Land] units> <when fighting in [Forest] tiles> <when fighting in [Friendly Land] tiles>
[+1 Production] from [Forest] tiles [in all cities connected to capital] <in [unimproved] tiles>

name: Carthage
declaringWar: Tell me, do you all know how numerous my armies, elephants and the gdadons are? No? Today, you shall find out!
attacked: Fate is against you. You earned the animosity of Carthage in your exploration. Your days are numbered.
defeated: The fates became to hate me. This is it? You wouldn't destroy us so without their help.
introduction: The Phoenicians welcome you to this most pleasant kingdom. I am Dido, the queen of Carthage and all that belongs to it.
tradeRequest: I just had the marvelous idea, and I think you'll appreciate it too.
uniques: Gain a free [Harbor] [in all coastal cities]
Land units may cross [Mountain] tiles after the first [Great General] is earned
Units ending their turn on [Mountain] tiles take [50] damage
[Gold] cost of purchasing [Land] units [-50]%
[+33]% [Gold] [in all coastal cities] <on foreign continents>
[-25]% [Production] [in all non-occupied cities] <on foreign continents>
[-33]% Unhappiness from [Population] [in all coastal cities] <on foreign continents>

name: Indonesia
startIntroPart1: Honour be with you, oh great hero Gajah Mada, prime minister of Majapahit and uniter of the Indonesian archipelago. The stories of your heroism on the battlefield are bested only by the legends of your sworn oath to unite the far-flung islands of Indonesia under one banner. Serving your queen and empire with loyalty, you not only strive to fulfill your oath and conquered any who stood in your path, but you succeeded in capturing what was then the entirety of the known archipelago, the first to unite what is today modern Indonesia.
startIntroPart2: Mighty warrior Gajah Mada, your people yearn for a strong leader who can return them to prosperity! Will you set out to conquer the neighboring kingdoms, further expanding your glory of your empire? Will you build a civilization that can stand the test of time?
declaringWar: Don't mean to stand in your way, but I have to protect them!
attacked: How dare you! Really insignificant as well!
defeated: You may win, but you cannot win upon my spirit.
introduction: You came before the great warrior, Gajah Mada from Nusantara!
hateHello: Are you a male concubine, stranger?
tradeRequest: What if we make a deal, you and me?
uniques: [+1 Food] from every [Farm] <in [Coastal] tiles>
[+1 Gold] from [Luxury resource] tiles [in all coastal cities]
uniqueText: After researching Astronomy, 3 coastal cities each provide 2 copies of unique Luxury Resources

name: Polynesia
declaringWar: The ancient fire flashing across the sky is what proclaimed that this day would come, though I had foolishly hoped for a different outcome.
attacked: It is obvious now that I misjudged you and your true intentions.
defeated: The hard-shelled crab yields, and the lion lies down to sleep. Kanaloa comes for me now.
introduction: Aloha! Greetings and blessings upon you, friend. I am Kamehameha, Great King of this strand of islands.
tradeRequest: Come, let our people feast together!
uniques: Enables embarkation for land units <starting from the [Ancient era]>
Enables [All] units to enter ocean tiles <starting from the [Ancient era]>
Normal vision when embarked <for [All] units>
[+10]% Strength <within [2] tiles of a [Moai]>
[20]% of excess happiness converted to [Culture] <when not at war>
All newly-trained [Water] units [in all non-occupied cities] receive the [Supply] promotion
[+1] Sight <for [Water] units>

name: Celts
declaringWar: You shall stain this land no longer with your vileness! To arms, my countrymen. We ride to war!
attacked: Traitorous man! The Celtic peoples will not stand for such wanton abuse and slander - I shall have your balls!
defeated: Vile ruler, know you have won this war in name alone. Your cities lie buried and your troops defeated. I have my own victory.
introduction: I am Boudicca, Queen of the Celts. Let no-one underestimate me!
tradeRequest: Let us join our forces together and reap the rewards.
neutralHello: God has given good to you.
hateLetsHearIt: Forward! Before I change my mind!
uniques: [+1 Faith] [in all cities] <with [1] to [2] neighboring [unimproved] [Forest] tiles>
[+2 Faith] [in all cities] <with [3] to [6] neighboring [unimproved] [Forest] tiles>
All newly-trained [Sword] units [in all cities] receive the [Survivalism I] promotion <in cities with at least [8] [Population]>
All newly-trained [Gunpowder] units [in all cities] receive the [Survivalism I] promotion <in cities with at least [16] [Population]>
